label: Description
value: Paper shows design of flowering stems with flying and perching birds. Border in design of flowers arranged in panels with scrolls. Printed in color on blue ground.

label: Provenance
value: This paper, according to donor, was put in the house now known at 566 East Hargett Street, Raleigh, North Carolina, at the time it was built (c. 1830)by Eleazer Colburn (great grandfather of donor).

label: Description
value: Horizontal rows of rust, brown, blue, and peach colored flowers each in combination with white on a cream ground (originally light yellow).

Hexagon pattern in gold, part of same circular motif at bottom right corner.

label: Description
value: Navy ground with surface divided into octagonal areas with squares intervening. Both the squares and the octagons contain stylized floral forms. The entire pattern is composed of extra wefts of white, tan, gold, and chartreuse silks.

value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound twill

label: Description
value: Only fragment of design remains. Large conventional rosettes in extra wefts of broad paper gold strips on dark blue ground.

value: Medium: silk, paper with applied gold foil Technique: plain compound twill

label: Description
value: Small-scale all-over pattern of small curving branches with conventional flowers and leaves in extra gold wefts on finely diapered ground of small diamond-shaped lozenges also in extra gold wefts. No selvage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and gold on paper strips Technique: plain compound twill

label: Description
value: Design of conventional flower forms in supplementary gold-colored silk wefts on navy blue, ribbed, plain cloth ground. Ribbing formed by bundled black silk wefts covered by the navy blue warps.

value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound weave

value: Design of ho-o birds and other conventional birds and cloud forms in secondary wefts of brown silk on navy blue ground.

value: Octagonal. Crowned united arms. Reverse: three cupids holding shield with mongram M.D.

value: Embroidery in formalized design of interlacements, leaves and carnations with narrow borders of carnations.

value: Narrow border with mermaids and scrolls ending in carnations and scrolls enclosing double-headed eagles. Wide border with floral sprays above an anchor, birds on plant growing out of a basket.

value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in herringbone, chain, buttonhole and stem stitches on plain weave

value: Wide border with design of birds on uprights stems bearing flowers and leaves, fish with scrolls; narrow border with mermaids holding tails, birds flowers and scrolls.

value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in satin, Bokhara couching, herringbone, outline and French knot stitches on plain weave

label: Description
value: Eight-pointed stars enclosing rampant addorsed lions, heads turned toward each other; the pointed-armed crosses forming the interstices are filled with symmetrical foliate arabesques. The pattern appears slightly raised in gold on blue and pink ground.  Fragment from a set of vestments from the Cathedral of Lérida, Spain.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk; gilded goldbeaters' skin wound around a silk core

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt

label: Description
value: White tablecloth with a central design showing the Last Supper repeated in two directions. Border composed of a scrolling vine interrupted by Biblical scenes. Loosely scattered floral forms are in the intervening space.

label: Description
value: Delicate serpentine foliage and flowers in fancy weave formed by floats of white silk wefts on plain weave ground. Floral bouquets brocaded in colored silks.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound weave with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Black lace border with scalloped edge formed by flowers with a curving stem with flowers and leaves rising from each border flower.

label: Description
value: Design of floral units brocaded in colored silk and gold and on a background design of undulating lines in gold. The ground fabric is in plain twill weave; it is tan and at top and bottom changes to brown and orange-red respectively. This change is produced by chine dyeing of the warps and change of color of wefts.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, gold foil on silk core Technique: plain twill with supplementary weft

label: Physical description
value: Medium: Technique: 1. Plain weave, paired warps, single weft; 2. Weft-faced plain weave, unpaired warps; 3. Plain weave foundation (warp single, weft single), supplementary wefts in weft-faced plain weave on paired warps, branched warps between sections 2 and 3; Sides: cut; Ends: one intact (warp selvage covered by stitching)

label: Description
value: Band of silver lace made up of three pieces. Insertion is in the design of a serpentine stem with a scalloped border stitched to either side.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silver in flat strips wound on a silk core Technique: bobbin lace, metallic

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. William A. Hutcheson
